p: Yearly influenza epidemics have severe effects on public health worldwide. Influenza can lead to hospitalisation and death, especially in the elderly and in individuals with comorbidities [ 1]. The annual attack rate is estimated to reach 5–10% in adults and 20–30% in children [ 2]. Every year, 3–5 million cases of severe influenza and around 290,000–650,000 influenza-related deaths occur [ 3].
